title: CFT Constraints on Parity-odd Interactions with Axions and Dilatons
abstract:
We illustrate how the Conformal Ward Identities (CWIs) in momentum space
completely determine the structure of a parity-odd 3-point correlator involving
currents, energy momentum tensors and at least one scalar operator in $d=4$.
Conformal invariance fixes almost all such possible correlators to vanish. The
only exceptions are given by the $\langle JJO\rangle_{odd}$ and the $\langle
TTO \rangle_{odd}$ which in momentum-space are protected by chiral and
conformal anomalies. Specifically, one can obtain a non-vanishing solution by
considering scalar operators such as $O=\nabla \cdot J_A$,
$O=g_{\mu\nu}T^{\mu\nu}$ or their shadow transforms. We comment on the
implications of these results that constrain the coupling of axions and
dilatons in a conformal phase of the early universe.
